author: Huawei
description:
At the #Huawei Innovation & Intellectual Property Forum 2025 in Beijing, Heiwai Tang, Associate Vice President, The University of Hong Kong, stated that invention is the single most important driver of prosperity for all economies. 

The next crucial step, Heiwai says, "is the emergence of great companies, like Huawei, that possess engineering prowess, manufacturing scale, and market vision to transform a raw idea into a practical and global product."

Read more from #IPR2025, "Advancing Innovation with Openness": https://bit.ly/4peAtCe 

Watch the full replay here: https://bit.ly/485ManW #IPMatters
title: Driving Global Progress: Great Companies, Greater Innovations

author: Huawei
description:
At the #Huawei Innovation & Intellectual Property Forum 2025, Marco Alemán, Assistant Director General of the World Intellectual Property Organization, emphasized Huawei's leading role in global patent activity and its long-term commitment to international IP systems. 

The event brought together global experts to discuss how openness and strong IP protection drive long-term innovation and highlight progress across key technology domains. 

Read more about #IPR2025 at https://bit.ly/3K6vCnF 

Watch the livestream replay at https://bit.ly/3K2V1yy #IPMatters
title: Huawei Showcases Global Leadership in Innovation and IP Protection

author: Huawei
description:
Ningling Wang, President-elect of the Licensing Executives Society International (LESI), emphasized that collaboration and openness are essential for innovation to thrive. At the #Huawei Innovation & Intellectual Property Forum 2025 in Beijing, Ningling shared that LESI relies on corporate members like Huawei to help build a sustainable IP commercialization ecosystem.

"Through the sharing of technological expertise, Huawei cultivated an ecosystem that encourages entrepreneurship, accelerates research, and delivers tangible solutions to pressing challenges," Ningling said.

Read more from #IPR2025, "Advancing Innovation with Openness": https://bit.ly/3K6vCnF and watch the livestream here: http://bit.ly/47SKxJY #IPMatters
title: Advancing Innovation with Openness to Build a Flourishing IP Ecosystem

author: Huawei
description:
At the #Huawei Innovation & Intellectual Property Forum 2025 in Beijing, Alan Fan, Vice President and Head of the Intellectual Property Rights Department at Huawei, shared how long-term investment in innovation and respect for IP drive Huawei's success.

He stated, "Huawei is both a patent licensor and a licensee. Huawei advocates a balanced IPR policy; our balancing philosophy is widely endorsed by the industry." He added that 48 Fortune Global 500 companies have become Huawei's licensees either directly or through patent pools.

Discover more from #IPR2025, "Advancing Innovation with Openness": https://bit.ly/3K6vCnF #IPMatters
title: Championing Shared Innovation, Openness & IP Rights

author: Huawei
description:
At the #Huawei Innovation & Intellectual Property Forum 2025 in Beijing, global IP leaders emphasized the value of openness, collaboration, and responsible licensing. Speakers highlighted how these principles, along with IP protection, fuel innovation.

"Open innovation drives society and technology forward, and it's in our DNA," Huawei's Chief Legal Officer, Liuping Song, said in the opening speech. "We are committed to an open approach to innovation. Huawei respects the IP of others, and protects its own, including patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets."

See the full coverage from #IPR2025 "Advancing Innovation with Openness" and explore more insights about intellectual property rights: https://bit.ly/3K6vCnF #IPMatters
title: Protecting Ideas, Powering Progress: Huawei's Open Innovation Vision
